titleStmt.title: Despatch from the US Consulate, June 13, 1883

bibl.title: Despatch from US Consulate
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: of plank and keel were flooding up but we still continued to work hard after all our hopes were over.

At 6 a.m. seven feet of water forward and 8 feet aft she having settled four feet in the sand By getting a large anchor and on the quarter she had worked head on to the shore and at low tide was about three ships lengths distant.

It was impossible to land at this point in a boat there being a very heavy surf on Concluded to leave as soon as possible as we had done everything possible to save him for if she were to break up during the night it would have been dangerous to have got clear of her with the boats. We took what we could of personal effects and provisions and left her at 2 p.m. on the 23rd May for Little Fish Bay about 60 miles distant. The vessel when we left her had silted 6 feet in the sand. We arrived at Little Fish Bay on the
